# Copilot Instructions for Tumenye

<!-- Use this file to provide workspace-specific custom instructions to Copilot. For more details, visit https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/copilot/copilot-customization#_use-a-githubcopilotinstructionsmd-file -->

## Project Overview
Tumenye is a digital literacy learning platform for Rwandan youth focused on Tech for Good initiatives. The platform provides interactive learning modules covering essential digital skills.

## Technology Stack
- **Framework**: Next.js 15 with App Router
- **Language**: TypeScript
- **Styling**: Tailwind CSS
- **Authentication**: NextAuth.js
- **Database**: MongoDB with Mongoose
- **UI Components**: Custom components with Tailwind CSS

## Design Guidelines
- **Theme**: Light blue and white color scheme
- **Typography**: Montserrat or Inter font family
- **Responsive**: Mobile-first design approach
- **UI Style**: Clean, friendly, and accessible interface

## Code Conventions
- Use TypeScript for all components and utilities
- Follow Next.js App Router conventions
- Use Tailwind CSS for styling with consistent spacing and colors
- Implement proper error handling and loading states
- Write clean, readable code with proper TypeScript types

## Features to Implement
1. Landing page with project mission
2. Learning modules (Word, Excel, Email, Online Safety)
3. Interactive lessons with quizzes
4. Progress tracking dashboard
5. User authentication system
6. Admin panel for content management

When generating code, prioritize accessibility, performance, and user experience.
